title: Neverwinter
notes: Playable. Has some audio crackling at times and drops frames after entering a new area but otherwise works well.

When you click on install, it installs the 200 MiB launcher. Then proceeds to download 12 GiB very slowaly (took ~3 days to complete). After that, it ran like native. It sometimes has a few hiccups but it's when it's 'patching' so there are lots of disk activity.
title: Neverwinter

notes: Game launcher and patcher runs with no problem or network delays. After that the game will launch, and the only "issue" it has was the long wait (3-5mins aprox) on the loading screen before the login screen in game. apart from that the game runs flawless. completed tutorial and got to "Protector's Enclave" map with no problems. High graphics, and also tested FXAA on fullscreen.
title: Neverwinter

notes: PvE for several hours, Lvl 20, everything works smoothly, good performace too. Might have an issue with first lauch when game tries to detect resolution and hardware, switched to 32bit and fast-launch only for first launch.
title: Neverwinter

gpu: Intel Open Source Technology Center Mesa DRI Intel(R) Ivybridge Mobile x86/MMX/SSE2
notes: fonts not working(just boxes instead of letters), Tried installing corefonts with protontricks but it didn't solved issue. The game worked for me out of the box when not using proton. I think the game would run fine except for the problem with the fonts, but only tested the login screen
title: Neverwinter

notes:
Since they recently pulled support for XP, I got the installer to run by simply changing it to win7 using protontricks. Everything installed perfectly and the patcher ran correctly. The download was slow but it can be temporarily sped up by checking the 'force verify' option again and again.
The first start takes time, about 5-10 minutes. So be patient. Subsequent starts are fast enough. 
Coming to performance, it is definitely lower than that of windows. But you may not see the difference with much beefier hardware. I ca=hanged the resolution to match my screen and reduced graphics to medium, disabled soft particles and things run smooth now. 
Definitely recommended.
title: Neverwinter

notes: I had to change the polling rate of my mouse (Roccat Tyon) to 125Hz https://bugs.winehq.org/show_bug.cgi?id=33643
title: Neverwinter

cpu: AMD A8-7650K Radeon R7, 10 Compute Cores 4C+6G
notes: It worked not so pretty much out of the box, the problems were that there was no font. So i changed my wine prefix to protons and than added mscorefonts. And then i had some lag issues probably cauze the performance of this game is not the best on linux. Two more things which are not nice. First i had to wait 10  min until the loading screen was fully loaded not just only the first loading screen. Second the game crashed twice appxm. after 15 min.
title: Neverwinter

notes: i use a blackweb rgb mouse and i had to work with the polling to get the mouse look from going way past the limits via my windows installation other than that the game runs smoothly on both 32 bit and 64 bit launches.
title: Neverwinter

notes:
Everything works. Havent tried the store though. Only needed to change windows version to win7 using proton tricks and it worked well. Did not face the missing fonts issue that some people are reporting. There is a noticeable input lag initially but it can be fixed by adding "WIEDEBUG=-all %command%" to steam launch options. Some stutters can be removed by setting cpu governors to performance. The very first load time IS LONG but after that it is normal and short. There are some lags initially, but as the game builds it cache the wrinkles get kinked out. 
With 32 hours into the game now, with the above tweaks, there is no rubber banding, no input lag, and works like a charm. GG
title: Neverwinter

notes: When you change the screen resolution the mouse is limited to a part of the screen, restarting the game solves this problem. When entering or leaving a room a few times the mouse works oddly, just click on the screen and it returns to normal. Other than that the game runs out of the box.
title: Neverwinter

notes: No tweaks needed if your mesa is updated runs perfect
title: Neverwinter

notes: Runs perfectly, but with a considerable FPS drop. My PC maintains solid 60FPS at all times on Win7, while with Proton it can barely keep 30FPS in more populated areas. The less populated areas work fine.
